title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a "DateTime" type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and providing an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999", the value is not being rejected as expected.
EB: The report design should reject and display an error for invalid date/time strings that do not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a "DateTime" type report parameter.
4. In the "default value" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
5. Save the report and observe that the invalid date/time value is not rejected and an error is not displayed.
